definition: famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: He's very deserving to be in the Hall of Fame.
sentences.chinese: 他能進名士堂，這一點也不特別。

sentences.english: The demeanor's substance was the freedom of the spirit that pursued the liberating country.
sentences.chinese: 嵇康是魏晉名士風度的代表人物。

sentences.english: Gong sun Long , is a famous scholar lived in the State of Zhao during the Warring States Period (475-221BC).
sentences.chinese: 戰國時期，趙國有位名士叫公孫龍。

sentences.english: Firstly, Dong Qichang developed intimate friendship with scholars of Anhui Province.
sentences.chinese: 一方面，董其昌與徽籍名士成爲密友石交。

sentences.english: Professor Yu is famous among Confucian scholars.
Ruanji and Jikang were ranked among the famous literati of that period who expounded the thought of Zhuangzi under the claim of corresponding to nature.
sentences.chinese: 阮籍和嵇康是兩位在任自然旗幟下發揮莊子思想名士。

definition: experienced scholar/old expert in the field
high-ranking officials in the court of a Chinese emperor
important official or statesman (in feudal China)
land-owning class, esp. during Wei, Jin and North-South dynasties 魏晉南北朝|魏晋南北朝
